wildFeature.name: a Crevasse, rock, ice or lava - across path
a Crevasse, rock, ice or lava - parallel to path
a Cave or sinkhole: rock, ice or lava
a Steep slope up - moderate athletics or treat as difficult (or ½ move), easy athletics or acrobatics to go down (or ½ move)
a Steep slope down - easy athletics or acrobatics to go down (or ½ move), moderate athletics or treat as difficult to go up (or ½ move)
a Peak
a Cliff up - climb DC 10, but half speed, across line of travel
a Cliff down - climb DC 10, but half speed, across line of travel
a Boulders or other broken ground
Light Foliage - bushes, heather or saplings
Snow or sand dunes or hillocks or dense thick trees (full cover)
Medium intermittent cover - ice formations, medium size trees etc, ¾ cover
a Ridgeline - assumes above you unless you are on it, across your path
a Ridgeline - assumes above you unless you are on it, parallel to your path
a Gully - assumes below you unless you are on it, across your path
a Gully - assumes below you unless you are on it, parallel to your path
a River or water course, parallel to your path
a River or water course, across your path
a Slippery surface - ice, wet rock, fallen trees, wet grass, loose shale
Very Soft ground - snow drifts, mud, floating plants, soft fine sand
a Bridge, rail or guided path, no cover except prone
a Ruin ¾ cover, no roof
a Building full cover, roof
a Monument, way marker, shrine, well or cache ¾ cover
Permanent Water - hotspring or similar
Raised Ground - on hill or outcrop
a Crossroad - or more routes cross here
a Mountain Pass- entry or crossing point
a Sheltered Bay - boats can come ashore
a River crossing - ford or bridge
where Rivers meet - 2 water courses
Resources - minerals or game
a Mysticalplace - ley lines or other mystical sources
a Hidden place - hard to find
